articles.originalTitle: 북한의 백두산, 유네스코 세계지질공원 등재
articles.translatedTitle: North Korea's Mount Baekdu Listed as UNESCO Global Geopark

summary.quote: The Baektu Mountain is characterized by its magnificent landscape formed by volcanic eruptions
summary.text: The North Korean part of Mount Baekdu has been designated as a UNESCO Global Geopark, following the designation of the Chinese part last year, making the entire mountain a Global Geopark. This is North Korea's first such designation, recognizing the area's geological value and commitment to sustainable management. The area is notable for its volcanic landscape and glacial landforms, with potential for future eruptions, having previously registered with UNESCO in 1989 as a World Biosphere Reserve.

articles.originalTitle: 유엔 "北 출생아 10만명 당 임산부 67명 사망"…南의 17배 수준
articles.translatedTitle: UN: 67 Maternal Deaths per 100,000 Live Births in North Korea... 17 Times Higher than South Korea

summary.quote: North Korea's maternal mortality ratio was estimated at 67 per 100,000 live births in 2023
summary.text: A recent UN report indicates that maternal mortality rates in North Korea have decreased significantly since the 'Arduous March' but remain 17 times higher than in South Korea. In 2023, North Korea's maternal mortality ratio was estimated at 67 deaths per 100,000 live births, compared to 4 in South Korea. While progress has been made in the last two decades, North Korea still falls short of the global target of reducing maternal mortality to below 70 per 100,000 live births by 2030.

articles.originalTitle: [북한날씨] 대체로 맑다가 밤부터 구름 많아져
articles.translatedTitle: [North Korean Weather] Mostly Clear, Becoming Cloudy from Evening

summary.quote: Strong wind advisory issued for several areas along the West Sea coast, Gangwon Province, and parts of South Hamgyong Province, with expected winds of 10-15m per second
summary.text: The weather forecast for North Korea indicates mostly clear skies on the 11th, becoming cloudy from the evening. A strong wind advisory has been issued for coastal areas, Gangwon Province and parts of South Hamgyong Province. Regional forecasts include clear skies in Pyongyang, Junggang, Haeju, Gaeseong, Hamheung, and Chongjin, with daytime high temperatures ranging from 15 to 25 degrees Celsius.

articles.originalTitle: 57년 전 "무장공비 왔다" 신고한 나무꾼, 故 김신조 마지막 배웅
articles.translatedTitle: 57 Years Ago, Woodcutter Who Reported 'Armed Guerrillas' Bids Farewell to the Late Kim Shin-jo

summary.quote: I wish he had lived a healthier and longer life, but it's regrettable and sad. I can only hope he rests in peace
summary.text: A woodcutter, Woo Seong-je, who first reported the infiltration of 31 North Korean guerrillas, including Kim Shin-jo, in 1968, attended Kim's funeral. Woo and his brothers were captured by the guerrillas who aimed to assassinate President Park Chung-hee. They were released after promising not to report the incident, but they immediately alerted the authorities, leading to a military operation where Kim Shin-jo was captured, and he later became a pastor in South Korea, repeatedly acknowledging the brothers saved the Republic of Korea.

articles.originalTitle: 美인태사령관 "주한미군 철수·감축시 北 남침 가능성 커져"(종합)
articles.translatedTitle: US Indo-Pacific Commander: 'If US Troops Withdraw from South Korea, North Korea's Invasion Possibility Increases' (Comprehensive)

summary.quote: If US troops disappear, the possibility of him Kim Jong-un invading increases
summary.text: Amid discussions about adjusting US troop deployments globally, US military commanders for the Korean Peninsula and Indo-Pacific region expressed concerns about withdrawing or reducing US troops in South Korea. Commander Samuel Paparo emphasized that the absence of US troops would increase the likelihood of a North Korean invasion and that a significant reduction would diminish the US's ability to overwhelm in a conflict. Commander J.B. Brownson argued that the US military presence in South Korea is critical not only for deterring North Korea but also for checking Russia in the East Sea and China in the West Sea.

articles.originalTitle: 美인태사령관 "주한미군 없으면 북한 남침 가능성 높아져"
articles.translatedTitle: US Indo-Pacific Commander: 'If US Troops Are Gone, North Korea's Invasion Possibility Increases'

summary.quote: If US troops disappear, the possibility of him Kim Jong-un invading increases
summary.text: US military commanders for the Korean Peninsula and Indo-Pacific region expressed concerns regarding potential troop reduction plans in South Korea. Commander Samuel Paparo emphasized that if US troops were absent, the likelihood of a North Korean invasion would increase. He further noted a significant reduction in troops would negatively affect the US's ability to dominate in conflict. Commander J.B. Brownson highlighted the critical role of US troops in South Korea, deterring North Korea and checking Russian and Chinese power in the region.

articles.originalTitle: "조총련, 北 대남 적대시에도 韓단체서 자금 지원받아"
articles.translatedTitle: "Chongryon Receives Funds from South Korean Groups Despite North Korea's Hostile Stance"

summary.quote: The Korean civic group continued to support schools under the Chongryon umbrella after last year, even though North Korea revised its constitution last October to include the statement that 'the Republic of Korea is a thorough hostile country'
summary.text: Despite North Korea's hostile stance towards South Korea, the pro-North Korean organization Chongryon (General Association of Korean Residents in Japan) has been receiving financial support from South Korean civic groups. These groups have reportedly provided funding for film production and cultural exchanges, even after North Korea officially designated South Korea as an 'enemy state'. It is suggested that Chongryon's continued engagement with South Korea is motivated by financial difficulties due to sanctions and the presence of South Korean students in Chongryon-affiliated schools.

articles.originalTitle: 강원 고성 비무장지대서 산불…진화 헬기 일몰로 철수
articles.translatedTitle: Wildfire in DMZ in Goseong, Gangwon Province… Firefighting Helicopters Retreat Due to Sunset

summary.quote: Wildfire in DMZ in Goseong, Gangwon Province
summary.text: A wildfire broke out in the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) in Goseong County, Gangwon Province. Firefighting efforts were initiated with helicopters, but operations were suspended due to darkness. Difficulties exist due to its location in the DMZ. Authorities plan to resume firefighting at daybreak.

articles.originalTitle: [북한단신] 김일성 생일 앞두고 각종 문화행사 개막
articles.translatedTitle: [North Korea Bulletin] Various Cultural Events Open Ahead of Kim Il-sung's Birthday

summary.quote: 4.15 Celebration Film Screening Week opened at the Pyongyang International Film Hall on the 9th ahead of Chairman Kim Il-sung's birthday April 15
summary.text: In anticipation of Kim Il-sung's birthday on April 15th, North Korea is hosting various cultural events. These include a film screening week at the Pyongyang International Film Hall and a National Calligraphy Exhibition and Art Exhibition at the Pyongyang International Cultural Center. Additionally, the 'Medical Science Symposium-2025' was held in Pyongyang, featuring research papers and achievements in disease prevention and healthcare.

articles.originalTitle: [게시판] 민주평통사무처 직원, 산불피해 구호·복구 특별성금
articles.translatedTitle: [Bulletin] Staff of the Secretariat of the Peaceful Unification Advisory Council Donate Special Relief and Restoration Funds for Wildfire Damage

summary.quote: The Secretariat of the Democratic Peaceful Unification Advisory Council announced on the 10th that it had donated 4.39 million won in special employee donations raised to support national wildfire relief and restoration to the Korean Red Cross
summary.text: The Secretariat of the Democratic Peaceful Unification Advisory Council has donated 4.39 million won collected from employees to the Korean Red Cross for wildfire relief and restoration efforts across the country. This is the only information provided.

articles.originalTitle: 미군 "주한미군으로 입지적 우위…동맹들 '부담공유' 늘려야"(종합2보)
articles.translatedTitle: US Military: 'Positional Advantage with US Forces in Korea… Allies Need to Increase 'Burden Sharing'' (Comprehensive 2nd Report)

summary.quote: What I see is that we currently have a positional advantage
summary.text: US military commanders and defense officials emphasized the strategic value of the US-ROK alliance while also calling for increased burden-sharing from Indo-Pacific allies, including South Korea. Commander Brownson highlighted that the US military presence provides a positional advantage and can check China. He noted South Korea's contributions to the US military and economy. However, John No called for strengthened force posture, increased allied capabilities, and greater burden-sharing to address all threats in the Indo-Pacific region.

articles.originalTitle: 접경지 '평화경제특구' 밀그림 나왔다…3개 권역 특화단지 조성
articles.translatedTitle: Border Area 'Peace Economy Special Zone' Blueprint Revealed… Creating Specialized Complexes in Three Regions

summary.quote: Contributing to the realization of the South-North Economic Community, achieving balanced development in the border areas, and establishing a sustainable promotion system are presented as the goals of the Peace Economy Special Zone
summary.text: The blueprint for the Peace Economy Special Zone, aimed at promoting balanced development in border regions and realizing a South-North economic community, has been finalized. The plan divides the 15 designated cities and counties into three regions: Western, Central, and Eastern, each specializing in different industries. The Western region will focus on future innovative manufacturing, the Central region on integrated agriculture, tourism, and light industry, and the Eastern region on tourism-centered logistics and services. The plan, in the long term, looks to contribute to a future economic community.

articles.originalTitle: 北, 코로나19 시설됐던 의주 비행장 복구…폭격기 재배치 완료
articles.translatedTitle: North Korea Restores Uiju Airfield Used as COVID-19 Facility... Bomber Redeployment Complete

summary.quote: The restoration of the Uiju Air Force Base means that North Korea has returned the priority of this facility from COVID-19-related activities to military training and operational readiness in accordance with its national security strategy
summary.text: North Korea has completed the restoration of the Uiju Airfield, previously used as a quarantine facility during the COVID-19 pandemic, and redeployed its bomber squadron after approximately four years. The airfield, located in North Pyongan Province, has been returned to operational readiness after being converted into a rail-linked facility for inspecting goods imported from China. The redeployment of 34 Il-28/H-5 bombers, previously stationed at other airbases, signals a shift in priorities from pandemic-related activities to national security and military readiness.

articles.originalTitle: 미군 "주한미군으로 입지적 우위…동맹들 '부담공유' 늘려야"(종합)
articles.translatedTitle: US Military: 'Positional Advantage with US Forces in Korea… Allies Need to Increase 'Burden Sharing'' (Comprehensive)

summary.quote: What I see is that we currently have a positional advantage
summary.text: US military commanders and high-ranking officials from the Department of Defense are emphasizing the strategic value of the US-ROK alliance, including USFK, while simultaneously discussing the need for increased burden-sharing among Indo-Pacific allies, including Korea. Commander J.B. Brownson stated that the presence of US forces in Korea provides a positional advantage. While the US acknowledged Korea's financial commitments, the US continues to pursue additional defense spending agreements from regional allies.

articles.originalTitle: 트럼프, 방위비·주한미군·관세 '패키지 협상' 시사 파장
articles.translatedTitle: Trump Signals Fallout from 'Package Deal' Negotiations on Defense Costs, USFK, and Tariffs

summary.quote: It depends. We pay for troops in Europe, and we don't get reimbursed much. Same thing with Korea
summary.text: President Trump indicated that he intends to negotiate defense cost-sharing, US troop presence in South Korea, and tariffs as a comprehensive package, potentially escalating the complexity of US-ROK negotiations. This approach suggests the US may leverage security concerns to demand increased financial contributions, potentially linking trade and security issues. The South Korean government maintains that economic and security matters are separate, but Trump's stance could lead to protracted and challenging discussions.

articles.originalTitle: [북한날씨] 흐리다 오전부터 맑아져
articles.translatedTitle: [North Korean Weather] Cloudy, Clearing Up from Morning

summary.quote: Visibility will be short due to fog in the West Sea of ​​Korea, so be careful to avoid accidents during navigation and port operations
summary.text: The weather forecast for North Korea indicates cloudy conditions on the 10th, clearing up from the morning. A warning has been issued for the West Sea due to expected fog and reduced visibility. Regional forecasts include clear skies in Pyongyang, Junggang, Haeju, Gaeseong, Hamheung, and Chongjin, with daytime high temperatures around 20 degrees Celsius.

articles.originalTitle: 美무역대표 "몇주, 몇달내 상호관세 협상 가능…中은 다른 선택"(종합)
articles.translatedTitle: US Trade Representative: 'Mutual Tariff Negotiations Possible in Weeks, Months… China Made a Different Choice' (Comprehensive)

summary.quote: There are a great number of countries that are saying we are not retaliating, we are going to work with you, we are going to find a path forward
summary.text: US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer stated that several countries are willing to cooperate with the US on mutual tariffs following President Trump's 90-day suspension for nations excluding China. Greer emphasized that China has chosen a different path of retaliation and uncertainty, contrasting with countries willing to work with the US for reciprocal trade. He noted that negotiations with these cooperating nations could occur within weeks or months. He claims that some provisions from phase one were only followed loosely by China.

articles.originalTitle: 주한미군사령관 "한미, 작년에 새 작계 서명…北 WMD 대응 강화"(종합)
articles.translatedTitle: USFK Commander: 'US-ROK Signed New OPORD Last Year… Strengthening Response to North Korean WMD' (Comprehensive)

summary.quote: Last year we made significant progress in new combat readiness. We signed a new Combined Operation Plan
summary.text: Commander J.B. Brownson revealed that the US and South Korea signed a new joint operation plan last year to counter North Korea's advancing nuclear weapon capabilities. The new operation plan, aims to enhance the ability of the Combined Forces Command to prepare for potential conflicts and will likely include responses to various North Korean attacks, including nuclear attacks. He noted that the forces practiced the operations during the Freedom Shield and Ulchi Freedom Shield drills.

articles.originalTitle: 주한미군사령관 "한미, 작년에 새 작계 서명…北 WMD 대응 강화"
articles.translatedTitle: USFK Commander: 'US-ROK Signed New OPORD Last Year… Strengthening Response to North Korean WMD'

summary.quote: Last year we made significant progress in new combat readiness. We signed a new Combined Operation Plan
summary.text: Commander J.B. Brownson announced that the US and South Korea signed a new operations plan in order to counter North Korean weapon development in 2023. The plan hopes to enhance the ability to react to conflicts. No other information provided.

articles.originalTitle: 美무역대표, 北·러 상호관세 제외에 "제재·금수 조처 때문"
articles.translatedTitle: US Trade Representative Explains Exclusion of North Korea, Russia from Mutual Tariffs: 'Due to Sanctions, Embargoes'

summary.quote: We don't think there is any trade relationship with North Korea. There is an embargo
summary.text: US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer clarified that North Korea and Russia were excluded from President Trump's mutual tariff policy due to existing sanctions and embargoes. He emphasized that the US does not have any trade relations with North Korea due to an embargo. He also stated that not including Russia in mutual tariffs did not imply an effort to increase commerce with the nation.
